text: The 2005–06 Macedonian Football Cup was the 14th season of Macedonia's football knockout competition. FK Bashkimi were the defending champions, having won their first title. The 2005–06 champions were FK Makedonija Gjorche Petrov who won their first title as well. ==Competition calendar== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !width=200| Round !! width=60 | Legs !!width=230| Dates played!!width=100| Fixtures !! width=100 | Clubs |- |style="text-align:left;"| First round (round of 32) ||align="left"| Single || 31 July 2005 || 16 || 32 → 16 |- |style="text-align:left;"| Second round (round of 16) ||align="left"| Double || 20 September and 18 October 2005 || 16 || 16 → 8 |- |style="text-align:left;"| Quarter-finals ||align="left"| Double || 2 and 30 November 2005 || 8 || 8 → 4 |- |style="text-align:left;"| Semi- finals ||align="left"| Double || 5 April and 10 May 2006 || 4 || 4 → 2 |- |style="text-align:left;"| Final ||align="left"| Single || 24 May 2006 || 1 || 2 → 1 |- |} ==First round== Matches were played on 31 July 2005. |colspan="3" style="background-color:#97DEFF"|31 July 2005 |} ==Second round== The first legs were played on 14 September and second were played on 19 October 2005. |} ==Quarterfinals== The first legs were played on 2 November and second were played on 30 November 2005. |} ==Semifinals== The first legs were played on 5 April and the second on 10 May 2006. |} Shkëndija 79 won 2–1 on aggregate. \---- Makedonija won 3–2 on aggregate. ==Final== ==See also== *2005–06 Macedonian First Football League *2005–06 Macedonian Second Football League ==External links== * 2005–06 Macedonian Football Cup at rsssf.com * 2005–06 Macedonian Football Cup at FFM.mk Macedonia Cup Category:Macedonian Football Cup seasons
title: 2005–06 Macedonian Football Cup
